instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
Liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.  
Initial presentation on usb-c ammeter:
First test: 20v and 0.03A Second test: 5v off and on alternating. 

No boardview.  Tried to map the water to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview.  Water was at <TRANSISTOR>Q7660</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7680</TRANSISTOR>.   Water discolored crystal Y1900.  Water was at some tiny resistor near the crystal that I could not determine identity using the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview.

Ultrasonic cleaned. 

Board seems to boot, with no display. 20v and 1-2A current. Charges the battery. Put board in a known good housing for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>--same, no display.
Usb-c makes sound on connect/disconnect.

Tried to check external display as follows: Plug in usb-c HDMI dongle, connect monitor. No image on monitor. Confirmed known good <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> produces external display.

Checked board again. Now found blown filter--may have missed on first look. Filter is probably L6701, L6702, L6703 by mapping to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Likely trackpad.

Tested board again making sure trackpad not plugged in. 

No display.

Diode mode at J8500 compared to logi.wiki for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No short or open found.

And here I am! 

What is the next step? Keep in mind I am not very experienced with Macbooks in general and may be missing some basics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What is the actual behaviour on the USB-C ports?
One steady 20V and other 5V cycling?

To see if board really boots, check for USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
After ultrasonic cleaning the usb-c ammeter on both ports is the same, normal.
20v 1-2A and battery charges.


I am not sure of the best way to check usb activity,
I plug in a usb-c android phone and it does charge.

I think usb activity is good.   No image/display.    I have confirmed that the display is good by plugging my known good <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board into this housing and screen works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
Power presence on USB-C port is not the same with activity.
Plug an USB pendrive installer with Link LED; if flashes, there is USB activity 100%.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
I can do that, but I will have to order something to plug in that will show a light.  Can we move forward for today?  I did hear a chime when plugging into usb port earlier.

Can we discuss "If you confirm usb activity, then with diode mode on screen connector nothing short/open THEN....???"


and 

If you have no usb activity, but laptop is charging with 20v 1-2amp on usbc port, THEN.....???

I would love to understand a framework of how to explore both of these questions.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message: Try PRAM reset and check if chimes again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
I have tried a usb-c LED mouse.  The LED does light up. 
I have tried a usb-c spinning hard drive, it does spin.


When I use a usbc HDMI dongle--no image on external display. 

I do NOT hear a chime when I boot the macbook.

I DO hear a "ding dong" when I connect or disconnect usb c


What would you do next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
Does this device have PRAM?

I tried holding down cmd-option-p-r while connecting usb-c
Also tried holding down cmd-option-p-r while connecting usb and pressing power button

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
"Plug an USB pendrive installer with Link LED; if flashes, there is USB activity 100%."
Did that?
An USB HDD adapter should have a Link LED.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
I searched Amazon for "usb c flash drive led" and did not find any results.   Do you have a link?  I am in the US.

I ordered the usbc mouse with LED and it does light up. I do not know if that is a data connection or not for the lights.
I have a usbc HDD but it does not have a light.  When I plug in this HDD I can hear it spinning.   I do not know if that is proof of data connection or not.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
Any USB pendrive with LED, should flash when connect it.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.ebay.es/itm/Philips-64-GB-USB-Stick-Snow-Edition-USB-3-0-Flashlaufwerk-mit-LED-Statusanzeige/154300488329?hash=item23ed069a89:g:-CYAAOSwFJZgCWED[/URL]
I use such pendrive with preinstalled macOS.
I'm sure you can find it in US too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
Usb-c external HDD confirmed to light up and blinks very little and then steady.
Confirmed on a working MBP the activity light should blink more and then stay steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
These high-density board are very sensitive to liquid spill.
Could be just a simple corroded resistor/cap, or accumulated crap under some BGA chip.
But also CPU may have been damaged.
Leakage from backlight, or <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to data lines, can be letal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message: Do you know what normal voltage testing would look like on the screen connector lines with a screen attached?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message: If you cannot confirm USB activity, or external video, no reason to search internal video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
I need to be able to say yes or no on usb activity.    I've ordered a usbc LED mouse, a usbc harddrive with LED and it sounds like both do NOT confirm or deny usbc data activity.

In the US, I have searched Amazon and I do not find a usbc flash drive that has an LED.    I know that you already have sent me an idea of Italian usbc LED.   I will continue to search for this tool

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image/no display
threads.message:
Almost all USB 2.5" HDD enclosures have Link LED.
In case you cannot find a correct pendrive.
